lexUnit.name: export.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send (goods or services) to another country for sale.

sentence.text: Malta exported £38 million of goods to Libya last year , and Libyans have regularly visited Malta to buy food , clothes and consumer goods .
In return the Soviet Union exported US$156 million worth of goods to Canada .
Guinness exported £975 million worth of goods from the UK in 1992 .
Within only a few years the company was exporting its products to central Europe , Russia and the US .
Since Sri Lanka previously exported about 200,000 tonnes of tea annually , only a little less than India , the biggest exporter , the loss is crucial .
Up to 100,000 thousand wild orchids are exported every year from Asia , and many thousands more are imported into America from countries such as Peru .
So France , which built far too much nuclear capacity with cheap government-backed loans , exports electricity to Britain and Italy at absurdly low rates .
Star Micronics now exports printers to Russia .
The institute already exports equipment such as indoor solar energy stoves and picnic stoves to 18 African countries .
Italy now exports a lot of salami .
Like his predecessors Arthur started out brewing ale , taking note all the while of a new black beer being exported by the London brewers to Dublin .

Around 230 tons of " highly toxic chemicals " have been illegally exported from Germany to Ukraine since the beginning of this year and the German authorities have been aware of the transports , Greenpeace has claimed .
There are accounts of dogs of Mastiff type being exported from Britain to Rome through an agent known as the Procurator Pugnacium ( provider of dogs ) .
Much of the finished cloth and tailored clothes were exported to worldwide markets .
By the time that Sheffield cutlers were selling their goods all over Britain and large quantities of knives , scissors , saws and scythes were being exported to America .
In the summer of 1989 during the " lamb war " , the government permitted the export of live sheep to France , and thousands of calves and pigs were also exported to the Continent for slaughter .
The wild safari park in Winston , Oregon , intends to export one of its lar gibbons through an animal dealer to a Mexican zoo known to have bought wild-caught gorillas on the black market .
Now the Chinese are in on the act : The Nanchang company are exporting their mopeds and motorbikes to Britain .
When he was Chancellor in the Thatcher Cabinet , he wrote to Liberal Democrat leader Paddy Ashdown that the machine tools exported by Matrix Churchill were ` not lethal . "
Does my hon. Friend agree that some of the best beef exported from Britain comes from the less-favoured areas and hill land ?
Roqueforts exported from France are often well salted to improve their keeping qualities , but the variety produced in France has a well-balanced , almost delicate flavour .
The share of woollen goods exported to Asia was 2.5 per cent in value in 1720 , but 5 per cent by 1770 .
Countries which currently use drift-nets will be obliged to provide documents certifying that fish exported to the US have not been drift-netted .
Moët et Chandon has the leading brand in most world markets and supplies one in four of all bottles of champagne exported from F rance .
